settings.title: WHAT DOES DIRECT TRADE MEAN?
settings.content: Direct Trade means avoiding intermediaries while establishing a direct working relationship between farmers and manufacturing companies. The reason for establishing this working structure is to be able to build a long term trusting & transparent relationship between both parties.

custom_css: .h2 {font-family: "Fjalla One"; font-size: 40px; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 20px; color: #3b2d22; opacity: 0.6; text-transform: uppercase;}

settings.title: DIRECT LINE OF COMMUNICATION
settings.content: Working directly with farmers enables us to ensure the welfare and success of the entire value chain. This also allows us to provide & market our products responsibility so that our customers can enjoy the experience of indulging in our products while feeling at ease that our farmers are well taken care of.

custom_css: .h2 {font-family: "Fjalla One"; font-size: 40px; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 20px; color: #3b2d22; opacity: 0.6; text-transform: uppercase;}

settings.title: ECONOMIC IMPACT
settings.content: By taking out “the middleman” we’re able to ensure that traditional standard fees are invested back in the farmers, and social support programs. By doing so we’re guaranteeing an even higher quality of our end products as well as supporting the much needed social & economical development of rural communities.

custom_css: .h2 {font-family: "Fjalla One"; font-size: 40px; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 20px; color: #3b2d22; opacity: 0.6; text-transform: uppercase;}

settings.title: ABOFCA
settings.content: Through our partnership with our master chocolatier Tyler Levitetz, we’re able to proudly & ethically source 100% of our cacao from ABOCFA in Ghana, Africa. In addition to growing & producing incredibly delicious cacao here’s a little more insight into why we love sourcing our cacao from ABOCFA.
